Error Checking


Functions

int fbGetError (fbird *fb)
char * fbGetErrorMessage (fbird *fb)
void fbSetErrorCallback (fbird *fb, void(*callback)(void *data), void *data)

Detailed Description

These methods are used to check whether an error occured as a result of an attempt to communicate with the flock.

Function Documentation

int fbGetError (  fbird *  fb  ) 
 

Return the last error code and clear the error indicator.

Parameters:
fb pointer to an fbird structure
Returns:
integer error code, or zero if no error
Note that the error codes are generated by the host computer, not by the flock. To check the error code for the flock, use fbExamineValue() to get the value of the FB_ERROR_CODE parameter.

All of the flock functions can generate errors except for the following: fbGetButton(), fbGetPosition(), fbGetAngles(), fbGetQuaternion(), fbGetMatrix().

char * fbGetErrorMessage (  fbird *  fb  ) 
 

Return some text that describes the last error.

Parameters:
fb pointer to an fbird structure
Returns:
text for the last error

void fbSetErrorCallback (  fbird *  fb,
void(*)(void *data)  callback,
void *  data
) 
 

Set a callback function for error handling. This function will be called whenever there is a communications error with the flock. it is not necessary to set an error callback.

Parameters:
fb pointer to an fbird structure
callback pointer to callback function
data pointer to data that will be sent to callback function
